**Mechanics Explanation:**

* When attached to a creature or planeswalker, Echoes of Eternity gives it a boost in power (+2) but reduces its toughness (-2), making it more vulnerable to damage.

**Attributes:**

* **CMC (Converted Mana Cost):** 5 (for complexity and rarity considerations)
* **Toughness:** N/A (aura enchantments don't have toughness)
* **Loyalty:** N/A (not applicable to creatures or planeswalkers)
* **Color Identity:** Blue (primary), with subtle undertones of White (represented by the mystical/ancient theme)

This enchantment, Echoes of Eternity, offers a unique combination of effects:

1.

**Mechanics:**

* Echoes of Eternity can be attached to either a creature or a planeswalker you control.

**Attributes:**

* **Echoes of Eternity** can be attached to any creature or planeswalker you control, making them more formidable in combat while also granting them an ability to affect opponents indirectly.

**Mechanics:**

* The enchanted creature gains +2 power but loses 2 toughness, making it more vulnerable to removal.
**How it works:** Echoes of Eternity can be cast on any creature or planeswalker you control, giving it a boost in power but reducing its toughness.

**Attributes:**

* **Color Identity:** Blue (primary), with hints of white in the flavor text and artwork to represent the connection to the ancient past.

**Abilities Breakdown:**

* **+2/-2:** This bonus/malus combination makes the enchanted creature more formidable in combat but also more vulnerable to dying.
* **Exile at end step:** The enchanted creature will be exiled until the next time you would gain life, effectively allowing it to dodge removal spells and board sweeps.
* **Exile effect:** At the start of your end step, the enchanted creature will be exiled until the next time you would gain life (e.g., during your upkeep).

* **Exile Ability:** At the beginning of your end step, the enchanted creature will be exiled until the next time you would gain life (e.g., when you win a life total-changing event or when your opponent loses life).
* **Exile ability:** At the start of your end step, the enchanted creature will be exiled until the next time you gain life, allowing you to cheat death temporarily.
* **Exile/delayed return:** At the beginning of your end step, the enchanted creature will be exiled until the next time you would gain life (e.g., at the start of your turn).
* **Exile at end step:** The creature will return to the battlefield at the start of your next turn, ready to attack again.

* **Exile and Return:** At the beginning of your end step, the enchanted creature will be exiled, only to return when you would gain life (e.g., during your upkeep).

* **Exile at end step:** The creature will be exiled at the end of your turn and return to the battlefield at the next time you would gain life (e.g., during your upkeep).
